metadata.Title: CVE-2020-14152 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - low
metadata.Description:
In IJG JPEG (aka libjpeg) before 9d, jpeg_mem_available() in jmemnobs.c indjpeg does not honor the max_memory_to_use setting, possibly causingexcessive memory consumption.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-14152` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libjpeg-turbo-progs - 2.0.3-0ubuntu1.20.04.1
libjpeg-turbo-test - 2.0.3-0ubuntu1.20.04.1
libjpeg-turbo8 - 2.0.3-0ubuntu1.20.04.1
libturbojpeg - 2.0.3-0ubuntu1.20.04.1
No subscription required

libjpeg-progs - 1:9d-1
libjpeg9 - 1:9d-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libjpeg6b package in focal is affected and needs fixing.
libjpeg-turbo package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.0.3-0ubuntu1.20.04.1').
libjpeg9 package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:9d-1').
